title: Scholz Party Seeks Investment, Taxes on Wealthy in Leaked Paper
description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s Social Democrats have drafted economic proposals, including a government fund to promote investment and a temporary “crisis levy” on the richest Germans, that seek to create 1 million new jobs by 2030, the RND media group reported.

title: UK to Mandate Annual North Sea Oil and Gas Licensing Rounds
description: The UK is to mandate annual North Sea oil and gas licensing rounds under plans to be announced this week, as part of efforts by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s government to give certainty to investors and reduce reliance on “hostile foreign regimes.”

title: Australia’s Prime Minister to Meet With Xi Jinping in Beijing
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese will be the first Australian leader to meet with President Xi Jinping in China in more than seven years on Monday, sealing a rapid recovery in diplomatic relations between the nations.

title: The Far Right Is on the Rise in Germany and Scholz Is at a Loss
description: The AfD has seen a surge in support and is targeting a string of elections next year to cement its gains

title: Israel Encircles Gaza City, Cutting off Northern Gaza From South
description: Israel made a “significant, expanded” push in Hamas-ruled Gaza on Sunday, encircling Gaza City in its entirety and attacking targets above and below ground, army spokesman Rear Admiral Daniel Hagari said.

title: Blinken Makes Unannounced Stop in Baghdad After West Bank Visit
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken made an unscheduled stop in Baghdad, expanding US diplomacy in the Middle East with the goal of preventing a spread of the Israel-Hamas war.

title: US Senators Call on Israel to Shift Gaza Tactics as Deaths Rise
description: Senior US senators expressed concern about civilian casualties in the Gaza Strip, signaling growing scrutiny in Washington over Israel’s military response to last month’s attack by Hamas.

title: Telecom Italia Board Said to Approve Sale of Network to KKR
description: Telecom Italia SpA has agreed to sell its land-line network to KKR & Co. in a government-backed deal valued at around €22 billion ($23.6 billion), according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Israel Says Hamas Is Using Hospitals to Conceal Military Activity
description: Israel’s army said Hamas is using hospitals in Gaza as bases of operation in a “systematic” attempt to conceal its military activities, expanding on claims Hamas has denied.

title: House GOP Pushing Ahead With Stopgap Funding Plan, Johnson Says
description: House lawmakers worked over the weekend on a stopgap measure needed to fund the US government beyond a Nov. 17 deadline, Speaker Mike Johnson said.

title: Iowa’s Governor to Endorse DeSantis in GOP Race, Snubbing Trump
description: Iowa Governor Kim Reynolds will endorse Florida Governor Ron DeSantis for the Republican presidential nomination at a rally in Des Moines on Monday, according to people familiar with the plans.

title: Efforts to Bump Trump Off the 2024 Ballot Raise Fears of Election Chaos
description: Minutes into a hearing on whether Donald Trump is constitutionally barred from being president again, Minnesota Supreme Court Chief Justice Natalie Hudson jumped in with her biggest concern: There could be “chaos” if some states keep Trump off 2024 ballots while others allow him on.

title: Ackman Urges Suspensions at Harvard to Tackle Antisemitism
description: Harvard alumnus and hedge fund manager Bill Ackman called on university president Claudine Gay to take immediate steps to reduce antisemitism on campus, a situation he called “dire” after meeting with students and faculty last week.

title: EU Says Surge in Antisemitic Incidents at ‘Extraordinary Levels’
description: The European Commission said the spike of antisemitic incidents across the continent in the last few days has reached “extraordinary levels” reminiscent of some of the darkest times in history.

title: Zelenskiy Urges Congress to Pass Ukraine Aid or Risk Bigger War
description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy implored Congress to maintain US military assistance to Ukraine, telling lawmakers who are blocking new aid that the alternative is to risk an eventual Russian attack on a NATO country that would draw in American soldiers.

title: The King’s Speech to Set Sunak’s 2024 Table: Sunday UK Briefing
description: Follow us at  @BloombergUK and on  Facebook, and wrap up your day with The Readout newsletter.

title: Braverman Open to Ban on Remembrance Day Pro-Palestinian Rally
description: UK Home Secretary Suella Braverman said she would consider any request by police to cancel a pro-Palestinian march planned for Armistice Day and labeled recent large demonstrations against the Israeli response in Gaza as “hate marches.”

title: Israel Bars Ultra-Nationalist From Cabinet Forum on Gaza Remark
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu suspended Amichai Eliyahu from cabinet meetings after the ultra-nationalist minister suggested Israel could drop an atomic bomb on the Gaza Strip.

title: Blinken Meets Abbas Amid Push for Pause, Civilian Protection
description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken met with Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas in Ramallah Sunday, as the Biden administration presses Israel to avoid civilian casualties in its war on Hamas in the Gaza Strip.

title: Flights Remain Canceled at Hamburg Airport on Hostage Incident
description: Flight operations at Hamburg Airport will remain canceled for an undetermined period of time as police try to diffuse a hostage incident.

title: Ukraine Recap: Kyiv Strikes Russian Missile Carrier in Crimea
description: Ukraine struck the Zaliv shipyard on the annexed Crimean peninsula on Saturday, hitting a Russian ship capable of carrying Kalibr missiles, air defense commander Mykola Oleshchuk said on Telegram. Russia’s defense ministry confirmed damage to a vessel from what it said was an attack from 15 cruise missiles, 13 of which were shot down. Russia-installed Crimean governor Sergei Aksenov said on Telegram that debris from some of the downed missiles fell onto one of the shipyard’s dry docks with no in

title: Putin’s Move to Secure Libya Bases Is New Regional Worry for US
description: Russia is moving to expand its military presence in eastern Libya, a plan that could lead to a naval base, giving it a significant foothold on Europe’s southern doorstep.

title: Turkey’s Defeat-Weary Main Opposition Party Elects New Leader
description: Turkey’s main opposition party picked a new leader months after it suffered another defeat at the hands of President Recep Tayyip Erdogan and as the country heads toward local elections in March.

title: Israel Latest: Gaza Crossings Risk Collapse Amid Hamas Push-Back
description: Evacuations of foreign-passport holders and the injured from the Gaza Strip to Egypt appeared to stall as Hamas and Israel accused each other of undermining a deal.

title: Hong Kong Leader Criticizes Proposed US Bill to Widen Sanctions
description: Hong Kong’s Chief Executive John Lee condemned a bill proposed by US lawmakers to sanction officials, judges and prosecutors in the city.

title: Malaysia, Japan to Explore More Defense, Maritime Cooperation
description: Malaysia and Japan will explore more collaboration in the defense and maritime sectors to preserve regional peace and security, Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said during his Japanese counterpart Fumio Kishida’s two-day visit to Kuala Lumpur.

title: CIIE Update: China Premier Pledges on Imports; Albanese Speaks
description: Chinese Premier Li Qiang kicked off the China International Import Expo with a promise to boost imports, while Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese sounded an optimist note on ties between the nations following years of friction.

title: Singapore’s Lee Says He’ll Hand Over Power Before Next Election
description: Singapore Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong said he will hand over power to his successor Lawrence Wong before the country’s next general election, and the transition could come as early as 2024.

title: China’s Li Vows to Boost Imports, Widen Foreign Market Access
description: China’s premier pledged that his nation would expand access to markets and also boost imports, which have fallen this year.

title: Uruguay President Overhauls Cabinet Amid Passport Scandal
description: Uruguay’s President Luis Lacalle Pou on Saturday reshuffled his cabinet amid accusations that members of his government tried to obstruct an investigation into a passport issued to an alleged drug trafficker.

title: Trump Peels Away Florida Legislators From DeSantis on Home Turf
description: Six Florida politicians defected from Governor Ron DeSantis to endorse former President Donald Trump at a rare gathering that brought the GOP frontrunner together with his rivals for the nomination.
